gurmukhi: ਤਿਨ ਬੋਲ ਬਿੱਪ੍ਰ ਮਹਾਨ || ਪਸੁਮੇਧ ਜੱਗ ਰਚਾਨ ||
transliteration: Tin Bol Bippra Mahaan|| Pasoumedh Jagg Rachaan||
translation: He called all the great Brahmins. In order to perform the animal sacrifice,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਜ ਪ੍ਰਾਗ ਜੋਤ ਬੁਲਾੲਿ || ਅਾਪਿ ਕਾਮਰੂਪ ਕਹਾੲਿ ||੪||੩੧੫||
transliteration: Dij Praag Jot Bulaae|| Aap(i) Kaamroop Kahaae||4||315||
translation: He called very leaned Brahmins, who called themselves very beautiful like Cupid.4.315.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਜ ਕਾਮਰੂਪ ਅਨੇਕ || ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਬੋਲਿ ਲੀਨ ਬਿਸੇਖ ||
transliteration: Dij Kaamroop Anek|| Nrip Bol(i) Leen Bisekh||
translation: Many Brahmin beautiful like Cuaid were especially invited by the king.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਜੀਅ ਜੱਗ ਅਪਾਰ || ਮਖ ਹੋਮ ਕੀਨ ਅਬਿਚਾਰ ||੫||੩੧੬||
transliteration: Sabh Jeea Jagg Apaar|| Makh Hom Keen Abichaar||5||316||
translation: Innumerable animals of the world, were caught and burnt in altar-pit thoughtlessly.5.316.

gurmukhi: ਪਸੁ ੲੇਕ ਪੈ ਦਸ ਬਾਰ || ਪੜਿ ਬੇਦ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਅਬਿਚਾਰ ||
transliteration: Pasu Ek Paid As Baar|| Pad(i) Bed Manatra Abichaar||
translation: Ten times on one animal, the Vedic mantra was recited thoughtlessly.

gurmukhi: ਅਬਿ ਮੱਧਿ ਹੋਮ ਕਰਾੲਿ || ਧਨ ਭੂਪ ਤੇ ਬਹੁ ਪਾੲਿ ||੬||੩੧੭||
transliteration: Ab(i) Maddh(i) Hom Karaae|| Dhan Bhoop Te Bahu Paae||6||317||
translation: The animal was burnt in the altar-pit, for which much wealth was received from the king.6.317.

gurmukhi: ਪਸੁਮੇਧ ਜੱਗ ਕਰਾੲਿ || ਬਹੁ ਭਾਂਤ ਰਾਜ ਸੁਹਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: Pasoumedh Jagg Karaae|| Bahu Bhaant Raaj Suhaae||
translation: By performing animal-sacrifice, the kingdom prospered in many ways.

gurmukhi: ਬਰਖ ਅੱਸੀ ਅਸਟ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਨ || ਦੁੲਿ ਮਾਸ ਰਾਜੁ ਕਮਾਨ ||੭||੩੧੮||
transliteration: Barakh Assiast Pramaan|| Due Maas Raaj(u) Kamaan||7||318||
translation: For eighty-eight years and two months, the monarch ruled the kingdom.7.318.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਨ ਕਠਨ ਕਾਲ ਕਰਵਾਲ || ਜਗ ਜਾਰਿਅਾ ਜਿਹ ਜੁਵਾਲ ||
transliteration: Poun Kathan Kaal Karvaal|| Jag Jaariaa Jih Juvaal||
translation: Then the terrible sword of death, whose flame hath burnt the world;

gurmukhi: ਵਹਿ ਖੰਡੀਅਾ ਅਨਖੰਡ || ਅਨਖੰਡ ਰਾਜ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡ ||੮||੩੧੯||
translation: Broke the unbreakable king, whose rule was entirely glorious.8.319.

gurmukhi: ਅਥ ਪੰਚਮੋ ਰਾਜ ਸਮਾਪਤ ਮਸਤੁ ਸੁਭ ਮਸਤੁ ||
transliteration: Ath Panchamo Raaj Samaapat Mast(u) Soubh Mast(u)||
translation: Here ends the Description of the Benign Rule of the Fifth King.
Then Muni became the king of the earth;
